text: Hey everyone, anyone come across using Sniply to curate trending content and drive traffic to chosen landing pages? Was wondering if anyone had any thoughts on it. (edited)

text: Wow I didn’t even know this channel existed! Reposting from <#C022W2V1Q0Y|-seo-talk> in case those of you who are particularly interested in TOOLS want to <https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfe0MWk1nOMf_KYUJULeTE_dPhD91gLRaBzjJm6E5mrOEMElg/viewform?usp=sf_link|contribute to our survey>! I’ll be happy to share the results with all of you here!

attachments.fallback: [September 9th, 2021 10:22 AM] kelseydonk: Hi friends! I’m working on a story about the top SEO tools for marketing, and I’m wondering if anyone here would want to participate in a survey I created to help me understand what tools SEO experts love (and hate) the most? Here’s a <https://forms.gle/zTZJutgohwrJ5EDF6|link to the survey>. Let me know if you have questions!

text: tried to use it in my previous company. interesting experiment, but pricey for the level of engagement we were getting (although that might’ve been a problem with the content)

text: Anyone have an opinion on Clearscope vs ClickFlow? We currently use Clearscope and love it. But a colleague on Marketing has need for some of the features ClickFlow offers that Clearscope doesn’t, so we’re trying to gauge if the content briefs/grading capabilities in ClickFlow are duplicative or complementary to what we already have.

elements.text: Anyone have an opinion on Clearscope vs ClickFlow? We currently use Clearscope and love it. But a colleague on Marketing has need for some of the features ClickFlow offers that Clearscope doesn’t, so we’re trying to gauge if the content briefs/grading capabilities in ClickFlow are duplicative or complementary to what we already have.

text:
Clickflow is in the content optimization game? Interesting. Last I heard it was just the same content decay tool that Animalz had already made.

In terms of Clearscope, I used it for quite a while and loved it. Shoutout to <@U01PQFQBGHJ> for both a great produce and REALLY great customer service.

elements.text:

for both a great produce and REALLY great customer service.

text: This is really interesting. 2 of my most important tools, Frase and Sparktoro, aren't on the list.

text: Would love to see a similar tool list for content optimization for SEO.

text: +100 on what Brendan said — I haven't used ClickFlow, so I'm not great for answering the question, but Bernard + team have been amazing at adding relevant tools as necessary when they make sense for users. If ClickFlow is offering something you don't currently have in Clearscope, it might be worth asking if it's a possible new feature coming someday soon.

text: That’s interesting to me too, <@UUXMCJQ15>! Our list isn’t comprehensive, which is why we’re hoping people also chime in with other tools they love. There’s just SO MANY tools! What do you love about Frase and Sparktoro?

text: Would definitely think about featuring those (and. your thoughts on them) in the content optimization tools section!

text: I would consider it to be more complimentary. ClickFlow isn’t designed to help create better content. Basically, it allows “users to run split tests on many different kinds of page elements, like titles, headings, body text and meta descriptions.”  Plus their content decay tool as already mentioned. <https://www.singlegrain.com/seo/marketmuse-alternative/>

attachments.title: ClickFlow as an Alternative to MarketMuse
attachments.text: ClickFlow is an SEO tool for content marketers, and is a great MarketMuse alternative. This post reviews the similarities and differences.
attachments.fallback: Single Grain: ClickFlow as an Alternative to MarketMuse

elements.text: I would consider it to be more complimentary. ClickFlow isn’t designed to help create better content. Basically, it allows “users to run split tests on many different kinds of page elements, like
titles
, headings, body text and meta descriptions.”  Plus their content decay tool as already mentioned.

text: <@U01ER4GNRJ7> Actually, ClickFlow has a content editor just like Clearscope. I prefer the editor in ClickFlow as it lets me take out the keywords I don't really want to mention and still maintain a good rating.

text: I think a list of content optimization with Frase, Topic, Clearscope, MarketMuse, etc. would be rad.

elements.text: I think a list of content optimization with Frase, Topic, Clearscope, MarketMuse, etc. would be rad.

text:
Sparktoro — SEO, going forward, is all about relationship building. Links and distribution is going to be less about platforms and more about people. Start with Sparktoro.

Frase — The ability to optimize content is similar to Clearscope (which I love, big fan of Bernard), but the ability to have unlimited reports each month solved a lot of my headaches with other similar to tools.

:slightly_smiling_face:

elements.text:
Sparktoro — SEO, going forward, is all about relationship building. Links and distribution is going to be less about platforms and more about people. Start with Sparktoro.

Frase — The ability to optimize content is similar to Clearscope (which I love, big fan of Bernard), but the ability to have unlimited reports each month solved a lot of my headaches with other similar to tools.

text: Amazing — I might follow up with you as I get writing, Brendan, but encourage you to fill out the survey if you haven’t so I can get your contact info and title and everything in the same place so I don’t lose it. We’ll definitely be including Clearscope, and that’s on the survey! I’ll add Sparktoro and Frase to my watchlist!
